qas.question: What had been Poland's stance towards the US, historically?
What led to the creation of an independent Poland?

answers.text: favorable American intervention in World War I

qas.question: What did Poland contribute to the "Coalition of the Willing"?
What had been Soviet stance towards the US, historically?

plausible_answers.text: favorable American intervention in World War I

qas.question: What led to the creation of independent Soviets?
What did the soviets contribute to the "Coalition of the Willing"?
To who was a quote referring to Poland as a Soviet state attributed?
What culminated in a Polish state dependent on Soviet influence?

context: Poland has historically been <a0_0><b3_0>staunchly pro-American<b3_0/><a0_0/>, dating back to General Tadeusz Kościuszko and Casimir Pulaski's involvement in the American Revolution. This pro-American stance was reinforced following <a1_0><b4_0>favorable American intervention in World War I<b4_0/><a1_0/> (leading to the creation of an independent Poland) and the <b7_0>Cold War<b7_0/> (culminating in a Polish state independent of Soviet influence). Poland contributed <a2_0><b5_0>a large force<b5_0/><a2_0/> to the "Coalition of the Willing" in Iraq. A quote referring to Poland as "the 51st state" has been attributed to <b6_0>James Pavitt<b6_0/>, then Central Intelligence Agency Deputy Director for Operations, especially in connection to extraordinary rendition.
